verses.roman:
cāri-dike cāri sampradāya karena kīrtana
madhye nṛtya kare prabhu śacīra nandana

synonyms: cāri-dike—in the four directions; cāri—four; sampradāya—groups; karena—performed; kīrtana—congregational chanting; madhye—in the middle; nṛtya kare—dances; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; śacīra nandana—the son of mother Śacī.
translation: Four parties were then distributed in four directions to perform saṅkīrtana, and in the middle of them the Lord Himself, known as the son of mother Śacī, began to dance.
